Buying A $50 Mini PC that performs Just As Good As My $500 Laptop

March 2, 2025

Hello, my name is Ruben Gutierrez, earilier this year I set out to buy a new work computer. My main goal was to get something for the lowest price I could get without sacraficing performance and speed. Let me just add that all together I've probably owned about a hundred computers ranging from $1500 laptops to to free desktops and I've repaired hundreds more so It's fair to say I've gotten really good at spotting the pros and cons between diffrent brands, price ranges, and features.

What I Was Looking For In My New Computer

I didn't really have a ton of requiremnts for my new computer.

Affordablitity. Max budget of $50 - $80 dollars.

A computer capable of handling heavy multitasking without performence issues (lag, freeze, etc.). Some of the software I use when I'm working are programs like VSCode, Inkscape, GIMP, Figma etc. basically a lot of programs for making websites and web content. These programs don't require a lot of RAM & CPU to run individually but when their used in a work envioremnet where you're constantly switcthing from window to window it can create issues especially on computers with lower end chip sets.

Researching The Computer

After doing research for a few days I came to a few conclusions.

I didn't want a laptop due to the fact that most laptop sold in my budgets price range usually contain low end chipsets that are designed for mostly internet surfing and emails.

Their are hardly any Good computers for this price range that can do what I need to do, which is website development.

Purchasing The Lenovo ThinkCentre M715Q

After countless hours of typing in variations of "cheapest mini pc" into Google and comparing tens of dozens of CPU's I can confidently say that I ended up purchasing the The Lenovo ThinkCentre M715Q. This Computer has a Ryzen 5 2400GE CPU chip set and 8 Gigs of RAM. This may not sound like much to people. and let me tell you this computer works almost as good as my $600 laptop.

This computer is 7 years old and performce better than laptops that came out this year. If you're looking for something

The CPU on this computer is caparable to
